title: Sovereign AGI Artifact Manifest Schema (v1.0)
description: Defines the structure for listing and validating artifacts produced during a code evolution or scaffolding cycle, ensuring traceability and integrity, specific to the S-AGI protocol.

manifest_id.description: A unique identifier (UUIDv4 preferred) for this specific manifest generation, guaranteeing global uniqueness.

protocol_version.description: The specific version of the Artifact Manifest Protocol this schema validates, decoupled from agent version.

agent_version.description: The version identifier of the Sovereign AGI instance (e.g., v94.1).

task_context.description: Contextual metadata about the originating execution task.

task_id.description: Identifier linking back to the overall AGI task/mission.

objective.description: The primary objective text or prompt used.

artifacts.description: A list of structured definitions for all produced, modified, or deleted files/components.

internal_id.description: An internal, temporary ID used by the agent during the generation cycle for efficient tracking.

path.description: The relative file path or system identifier of the artifact.

type.description: Categorization of the artifact content, extended to include 'model' and 'data'.

status.description: The action taken or final state of the file relative to the input context.

checksum_hash.description: SHA-256 hash of the artifact content. Required unless status is 'deleted'.

checksum_algorithm.description: The cryptographic hashing algorithm used for integrity verification (currently fixed to SHA256).

size_bytes.description: Size of the artifact file in bytes.

diff_context.description: Reference identifier or path to the unified diff patch against the original file, if status is 'modified'.
